reviewText:
To get the reticent Kay Graham to open up, is no easy feat.  Charlie Rose earned his
money on this revealing interview by not only what was said, but what was left unsaid.
Always the perfect lady, her face tells it all.  Thrown into the job of Washington Post
chief honcho following the suicide of her brilliant, talented husband, her baptism by
fire, forced to call the shots on Watergate for her newspaper, is the real
untold story of that era.
